","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"AVIG5911","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"12 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"AVIG5911 - Flying Operations 1","description":"

This course is the first stage of the theoretical and practical flying training associated with the Commercial Pilot Licence. The theoretical component is taught as three discrete subjects at Commercial Pilot level: Navigation; Meteorology; and, Flight Rules and Air Law. The Civil Aviation Safety Regulations 1998 Part 61 Manual of Standards is the primary source of the course syllabus. The material is covered at a theoretical level and then integrated into practical flying. The flying training covers the general and cross-country sequences required for the issue of a Private Pilot Licence.


Condition of enrolment: A pass in Flight Screening is an admission requirement for the Graduate Diploma in Flying. AVIG5911 is the first course in the program and completion of this course is compulsory.

CASA exam feedback is given immediately after the exam via Knowledge Deficiency Report.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"7bd7617bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619cf","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"84e7617bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"c0e7617bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d5","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"bfd7617bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b6","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Dual flights as described in Phase 4 student records","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"40","description":"

Dual flights are conducted and assessed as part of the private pilot licence flying syllabus specified in Appendix E7 of the UNSW Operations Manual. The syllabus of flying has been approved by the Civil Aviation Safety Authority and conforms to the applicable legislation.

Students receive feedback directly from the flying instructor immediately after each flight and are required to certify the corresponding electronic training record prior to subsequent flights.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"00e7617bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"3fd7617bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619cc","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"7bd7617bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619cf","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"84e7617bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"c0e7617bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d5","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"e3d7617bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619a9","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/AVIG5911.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}
contentlets.keywords: aviation,safety,risk management,decision-making,private pilot licence,private pilot licence fee help
contentlets.description:
This course is the first stage of the theoretical and practical flying training associated with the Commercial Pilot Licence. The theoretical component is taught as three discrete subjects at Commercial Pilot level: Navigation; Meteorology; and, Flight Rules and Air Law. The Civil Aviation Safety Regulations 1998 Part 61 Manual of Standards is the primary source of the course syllabus. The material is covered at a theoretical level and then integrated into practical flying. The flying training covers the general and cross-country sequences required for the issue of a Private Pilot Licence.

Condition of enrolment: A pass in Flight Screening is an admission requirement for the Graduate Diploma in Flying. AVIG5911 is the first course in the program and completion of this course is compulsory.
contentlets.title: Flying Operations 1

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"AVIG5912","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"12 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"AVIG5912 - Flying Operations 2","description":"

This course is the second stage in theoretical and practical flight training for the Commercial Pilot Licence. The theoretical component is taught as four discrete subjects at Commercial Pilot level. The subjects are Aircraft General Knowledge; Operations, Performance and Flight Planning; Human Factors; and, Aerodynamics. The Civil Aviation Safety Regulations 1998 Part 61 Manual of Standards is the primary source of the course syllabus. The material is covered at a theoretical level and then integrated into practical flying. The flying training covers the night flying and instrument flying elements of the Commercial Pilot syllabus and further consolidates the skills developed previously through solo flying practice.

CASA exam feedback is given immediately after the exam via Knowledge Deficiency Report.

contentlets.description: This course is the second stage in theoretical and practical flight training for the Commercial Pilot Licence. The theoretical component is taught as four discrete subjects at Commercial Pilot level. The subjects are Aircraft General Knowledge; Operations, Performance and Flight Planning; Human Factors; and, Aerodynamics. The Civil Aviation Safety Regulations 1998 Part 61 Manual of Standards is the primary source of the course syllabus. The material is covered at a theoretical level and then integrated into practical flying. The flying training covers the night flying and instrument flying elements of the Commercial Pilot syllabus and further consolidates the skills developed previously through solo flying practice.

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"AVIG5913","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"12 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"AVIG5913 - Flying Operations 3","description":"

This course is the final stage of training for the Commercial Pilot Licence including the flight test and the introduction of multi-engine and instrument rating flying. The theoretical component covers the underpinning knowledge for a command instrument rating, including Airways Procedures, Radio Navigation Aids, Meteorology and Satellite Navigation taught at a theoretical level and then integrated into practical operations through flight and ground training. The flying training covers the operational aspects of commercial flying and consolidates the elements of the syllabus previously covered. Following the flight test for the issue of the Commercial Pilot Licence, the practical flying shifts focus to the initial multi-engine class rating and instrument rating with a combination of synthetic trainer and multi-engine flight exercises.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"5a34e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b6","name":"Blended in-person / online - Intensive"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Commercial Pilot Licence Flight Test","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"","description":"

The flight test is conducted by a qualified Flight Examiner in accordance with the Civil Aviation Safety Authority Flight Examiner Handbook and the Civil Aviation Safety Regulations 1998 Part 61.

The Flight Examiner gives feedback immediately at the conclusion of the flight test and students are  required to certify the corresponding electronic training record prior to subsequent flights, plus the official licensing documents.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"1234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"1634e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a961982","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a961985","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"5e34e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"d234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619ad","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"4634e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a961952","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Dual flights as described in Phase 5 and 7 student records, from sortie 5.24 to sortie 7.08","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"50","description":"

Dual flights are conducted and assessed as part of the commercial pilot licence flying syllabus specified in Appendix E7 of the UNSW Operations Manual. The syllabus of flying has been approved by the Civil Aviation Safety Authority and conforms to the applicable legislation.

Students receive feedback directly from the flying instructor immediately after each flight and are required to certify the corresponding electronic training record prior to subsequent flights.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"1234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"1634e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a961982","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a961985","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"5e34e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"d234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619ad","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"4e34e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a96194d","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"UNSW Instrument Rating Examination","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"25","description":"

2 papers of 40 multiple questions each conducted at the Flying Operations Unit. Exam style, scope and conditions similar to the external exam required by federal licensing and accreditation requirements.

Feedback is given in class at the conclusion of the exam.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"1234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a961985","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"8e34e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a961956","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Instrument rating examination","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"25","description":"

The examination is an aeronautical knowledge requirement for the issue of an instrument rating conducted by the Civil Aviation Safety Authority. Details are given at:

https://www.casa.gov.au/standard-page/irex-instrument-rating

CASA exam feedback is given immediately after the exam via Knowledge Deficiency Report.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"1234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a961985","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"c634e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a96195b","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Multi-engine Aeroplane Class Rating Flight Test","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"","description":"

The flight test is conducted by a qualified Flight Examiner in accordance with the Civil Aviation Safety Authority Flight Examiner Handbook and the Civil Aviation Safety Regulations 1998 Part 61.

The Flight Examiner gives feedback immediately at the conclusion of the flight test and students are  required to certify the corresponding electronic training record prior to subsequent flights, plus the official licensing documents.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"1234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"1634e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a961982","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a961985","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"5e34e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"d234e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a9619ad","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"ce34e667dbf99850eb6b147a3a96195f","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/AVIG5913.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}

contentlets.description: This course is the final stage of training for the Commercial Pilot Licence including the flight test and the introduction of multi-engine and instrument rating flying. The theoretical component covers the underpinning knowledge for a command instrument rating, including Airways Procedures, Radio Navigation Aids, Meteorology and Satellite Navigation taught at a theoretical level and then integrated into practical operations through flight and ground training. The flying training covers the operational aspects of commercial flying and consolidates the elements of the syllabus previously covered. Following the flight test for the issue of the Commercial Pilot Licence, the practical flying shifts focus to the initial multi-engine class rating and instrument rating with a combination of synthetic trainer and multi-engine flight exercises.

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"AVIG5914","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"12 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"AVIG5914 - Flying Operations 4","description":"

This course covers the practical flying of multi-engine aeroplanes in commercial operations in all but extreme weather by day and night. The theory component completed in AVIA 5913 is applied practically to the conduct of instrument flight rules flying operations. The practical training is an integrated program of synthetic trainer exercises and flights. Flights are conducted by day and night in all weather conditions (except extreme) culminating in the flight test for the issue of an Instrument Rating.


 


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"225b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a961965","name":"Blended in-person / online - Intensive"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Instrument rating flight test","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"","description":"

The flight test is conducted by a qualified Flight Examiner in accordance with the Civil Aviation Safety Authority Flight Examiner Handbook and the Civil Aviation Safety Regulations 1998 Part 61.

The Flight Examiner gives feedback immediately at the conclusion of the flight test and students are  required to certify the corresponding electronic training record prior to subsequent flights, plus the official licensing documents.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"125b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a961956","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"265b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a961961","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5e5b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a961958","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"9a5b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a96195b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"d65b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a96195e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"4a5b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a96194c","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Dual sorties as described in Phase 8 training records, from sortie 8.01 to the conclusion of the phase.","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"100","description":"

Dual flights are conducted and assessed as part of the instrument rating flying syllabus specified in Appendix E9 of the UNSW Operations Manual. The syllabus of flying has been approved by the Civil Aviation Safety Authority and conforms to the applicable legislation.

Students receive feedback directly from the flying instructor immediately after each flight and are required to certify the corresponding electronic training record prior to subsequent flights.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"125b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a961956","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"265b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a961961","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5e5b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a961958","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"9a5b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a96195b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"d65b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a96195e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"8a5b9e2fdb799850eb6b147a3a96193b","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/AVIG5914.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}

contentlets.description: This course covers the practical flying of multi-engine aeroplanes in commercial operations in all but extreme weather by day and night. The theory component completed in AVIA 5913 is applied practically to the conduct of instrument flight rules flying operations. The practical training is an integrated program of synthetic trainer exercises and flights. Flights are conducted by day and night in all weather conditions (except extreme) culminating in the flight test for the issue of an Instrument Rating.
